column1: Table 4. Point of entry into problem-solving courts, by type of court, 2012
Report title: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012 NCJ 249803
Data source: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012
Authors: Suzanne M. Strong, Ph.D., and Ramona R. Rantala, Tracey Kyckelhahn, Ph.D.
Table 4. Point of entry into problem-solving courts, by type of court, 2012
Note: Detail may sum to more than 100% because multiple responses were allowed. Percentages are based on 96.6% item response rate.
a/Includes entry after violation or revocation of parole.
b/Includes acceptance on a case-by-case basis, post-referral from outside agency, entry after child adjudicated dependent, and entry after admitting to impaired ability
c/Handles alcohol- or drug-dependent offenders also charged with a driving offense.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012.
